title: 103_s970
content: There is no information provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to increase various monetary amounts. Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to increase various monetary amounts as follows: $1,040, $1,730, $2,152, $2,371, $2,698, and $3,015. Section 1114 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to increase monetary amounts to $1,295, $1,928, and $1,935. SEC. 2. Additional compensation for dependents is increased in various subparagraphs of Section 1115(1) of title 38, United States Code. The amounts are adjusted to $103, $174, $71, $82, $191, and $160. SEC. 3. Clothing allowance is provided for certain disabled veterans. SEC. 3. Clothing allowance for disabled veterans increased to $466. SEC. 4. Amendments made to dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. Monthly pay rates for military personnel range from $634 for E-1 to $1,627 for O-10. Surviving spouse's rate varies based on the veteran's rank, ranging from $934 for certain senior enlisted positions to a higher rate of $1,627 for top military leadership roles. The surviving spouse's rate, as designated by section 402 of this title, shall be $1,744. SEC. 5. Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Children: Amends subsections (c) and (d) by increasing the compensation amounts to $191 and $93 respectively. DIC for Orphan Children and Supplemental DIC for Disabled Adult Children are amended to increase compensation amounts. For Orphan Children, the amounts are increased to $319, $460, $595, and $117. For Disabled Adult Children, the amounts are increased to $191, $319, and $157. In subsection (c), the compensation amount is increased from $157 to $162. Section 3703(c)(4)(B) of title 38, United States Code, is amended to clarify the financing of discount points in certain loan cases.
